contentencoded: Ireland will close a big loophole that allowed Apple and other companies to avoid paying taxes on some profit. The BBC's Diarmaid Fleming reports on the latest from Dublin.
teaser: Apple used the rule to shelter $40 billion in profits.
title: Ireland to close Apple tax loophole
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, October 16, 2013
contenttemplated:
[{"type":"text/html","content":"

Ireland will close a big loophole that allowed Apple and other companies to avoid paying taxes on some profit. The BBC's Diarmaid Fleming reports on the latest from Dublin.

"}]
description: Apple used the rule to shelter $40 billion in profits.
